TopicTitle: [KSP 1.3] InfiniteDice ICE -Engines, Transmissions, for Atmospheric Vehicles

Articles.Content: Is proximity to the engine a heat issue. Had a mk1 lander pod over the 4c and it caught fire.

Yeah I finally figured it out. I wasn't engaging the gears. I had tried selecting changing the gears from the popup menu but didn't work for me. As soon as I used the pageup/pagedown hotkeys the gears changed and I was able to mooooove!

Now if only the 64-bit version of ksp was released so my game wouldn't keep crashing from all of the mods, especially when reverting/returning to hangar.

could you help me?

i still couldn't move, even when i go into gear.....

i have the engine running, the transmission in place, gear seems to be changing..... but the it's not running

Are you braking? Tap B.

Also, right click the wheels. The wheels need to have the motors engaged.
i have one question...when will you release aircraft parts?

Are you braking? Tap B.

Also, right click the wheels. The wheels need to have the motors engaged.

yup, not braking, motors on, in 1st gear, engine revving up high.....

but i do notice somthing weid, it's like the tire isn't touching the ground, i could rock my rover back and forth

yup, not braking, motors on, in 1st gear, engine revving up high.....

but i do notice somthing weid, it's like the tire isn't touching the ground, i could rock my rover back and forth

Check your wheel placement. Double check that my included crafts work.
So do ICE and Skillful work with .24?

Recompiled the DLL, with minor changes. Haven't tested the mod extensively as I'm on vacation. Post issues as normal to the thread.

There is no need to download the mod all over again, unless you never had it or would like to get a fresh copy, just follow the updated DLL download link in this thread's opening post, and download the updated DLL from my site. Copy over the 0.23.5 DLL/s where needed in the SAME location.

Cheers.

Is there a way to migrate stock wheels to ICE?

EDIT: After quite a bit of time playing with these new wheels, they really need a more realistic amount of grip. I've slid backwards at 10m/s after trying to turn about 10 degrees....

Edited July 25, 2014 by zack2014
I would also like to use the stoke wheels as well as the wheels in this mod.

Is there a way to migrate stock wheels to ICE?

EDIT: After quite a bit of time playing with these new wheels, they really need a more realistic amount of grip. I've slid backwards at 10m/s after trying to turn about 10 degrees....

There is some challenge in coding all the conditions for dynamic wheel grip. I'll be making a few changes to improve it in the next update. Also a big factor is the suspension setup. If you get horrible traction try adjusting the suspension.

Is the engine red as if you had your mouse over it but red instead of green? That means you are over-revving the engine and need to throttle down a little bit.

Is the engine red as if you had your mouse over it but red instead of green? That means you are over-revving the engine and need to throttle down a little bit.

Mike i have the .dll file

so i have 2 dll's ( IDiCE.dll and ModuleManager.2.2.0 .dll )

do i need to rename idice dll or is it good how i have it ?

The IDiCe.dll is fine, but it should be in the Plugins folder inside the IDiCEr1 (Which goes inside the GameData folder) folder alone. Not inside GameData where ModuleManager normally is.

The IDiCe.dll is fine, but it should be in the Plugins folder inside the IDiCEr1 (Which goes inside the GameData folder) folder alone. Not inside GameData where ModuleManager normally is.
